page.title: 08Employment in Dean
page.content: Many residents are employed outside the village, but a not unimportant minority do work within the community. Being a rural area there are obviously several farmers, 1 with a large herd of Kym Valley Pedigree Friesan cattlew, the others are mainly arable farmers. The village shop and the Post Office employ several people, the former also operating a mobile shop and delivery service around the area, the latter also serving the village of Yelden on a Thursday. There is a dairy situated in Lower Dean and this delivers milk daily. A small engineering works, a tree felling business and the 2 public houses all use local labour. A Suzuki violin teacher has a number of pupils from a very wide area. A carpenter makes beautiful furniture.
